articles.title: Argentine official visits neighbors to bolster Falklands claim
articles.description: For Carmona, Brazilian support for Argentina's claim is as solid as ever. "Argentina is asking neighboring countries to apply a restrictive criterion so the flights that are supposedly humanitarian are they are not reinforcing British military logistical presence in the Falklands," he said.

articles.title: In Argentina, massive protests call for higher wages, lower inflation
articles.description: The South American nation’s economic crisis has seen the ranks of the poor swell to 40 per cent of the population as the annual inflation rate hovers around 70 per cent
articles.content:
Demonstrators march towards the National Congress during a protest against rising inflation in Buenos Aires, Argentina, on Aug. 17.AGUSTIN MARCARIAN/Reuters

articles.title: In Argentina, mass protests demand higher wages, lower inflation
articles.description: "We can't continue with this level of inflation where everyday we keep losing parts of our salary," said Pablo Moyano, head of the CGT workers' union that mostly represents government employees. Prices at grocery stores and shops are regularly updated to reflect galloping inflation, which last month alone rose 7.4%, the highest monthly rise in two decades.
articles.content:
Thousands of frustrated Argentines clogged downtown Buenos Aires on Wednesday in raucous street protests, demanding government action to boost salaries and unemployment benefits battered by surging consumer prices and a weakening peso currency.

articles.title: ‘He’s not Jesus Christ’: Argentina urged to keep easing pressure on Lionel Messi
articles.description: Former soccer player Gabriel Batistuta is happy to see the responsibility being shared among the Argentinian team rather than the pressure on Lionel Messi's shoulders. articles.title: Inconsequential Brazil vs Argentina FIFA World Cup Qualifier Cancelled
articles.description: With nothing riding on the match as both countries have already qualified for the World Cup, which begins in Qatar on November 20, they had pleaded with world football's governing body FIFA to cancel the match definitively
articles.content:
Last year’s aborted World Cup qualifier between Brazil and Argentina will not be replayed, the two South American countries’ football associations said on Tuesday.
